result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob J. Stoltz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain GFE in FTE/schooling/combination of two.

Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, subject to random UA testing to abide by compliance.  

No contact with A.G. unless approved by agent.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Complete any assessment, counseling or treatment deemed necessary by agent.  Complete AODA assessment with follow through.  Complete SAFE intake program and any follow up.  DNA sample unless already been completed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes:
AODA.  

SAFE program. 

Payment of any outstanding fees and costs as previously assessed.

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 8:57am
INCLUDES 14CM1793, 15CF383, 15CF966, 15CM2000
State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer.  Deft appears in person, in custody, with Atty Tina Abernethy-Mays.
  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to:
15CF383:
Ct. 1 Strangulation and Suffocation- repeater- domestic abuse >> dismissed outright
Ct. 2 Battery- repeater- domestic abuse >> dismissed outright
Ct. 3 Disorderly Conduct- repeater- domestic abuse >> D&RI
Ct. 5 Bail Jumping- misdemeanor- repeater >> D&RI
15CF966:
Ct. 2 Possess Drug Paraphernalia >> D&RI
15CM2000:
Ct. 2 Resisting or Obstructing an Officer- repeater >> D&RI
COURT grants above

PLEA: 
14CM1793:
Ct. 1 Disorderly Conduct- repeater >> NO CONTEST
15CF383:
Ct. 4 Disorderly Conduct- repeater- domestic abuse >> NO CONTEST
15CF966:
Ct. 1 Possession of Methamphetamine >> NO CONTEST
15CM2000:
Ct. 1 Resisting or Obstructing an Officer- repeater >> NO CONTEST
Ct. 3 Bail Jumping- Misdemeanor >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: 15CF966 Ct. 1 & 15CF383 Ct. 4: w/hold sentencing. 3 years probation. 15CM2000 Ct. 1 and Ct. 3 & 14CM1793 Ct. 1: w/hold sentencing. 2 years probation. All terms of probation to run concurrently with each other. 
CONDITIONS of all counts: Complete any assessment, counseling, or treatment deemed necessary by agent. Complete AODA assessment with follow through. Complete SAFE intake program and any follow up. Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, subject to random UA's testing to abide by compliance. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of two. No contact with A.G. unless approved by agent. Pay one domestic abuse surcharge. Pay CC. Pay DNA sample and surcharge, unless already been completed. Deft child placement will be decided in CHIPS case. Zero days credit on all counts.
